Stephen.text: Apple replaces the "Plus" iPhone with an all new model...
Stephen.full-pick-text: Apple replaces the "Plus" iPhone with an all new model. It's the thinnest iPhone ever, but is made of titanium to remain strong. It has no Camera Control and/or Action Button. It does not offer an always-on display.
Stephen.notes:
• "It's the thinnest iPhone ever, but is made of titanium to remain strong."
  • "It has no Camera Control and/or Action Button."
  • "It does not offer an always-on display."

Stephen.text: Apple ships the Apple Watch Ultra 3
Stephen.full-pick-text: Apple ships the Apple Watch Ultra 3

Stephen.text: The M1 MacBook Air is not for sale at the end of 2025
Stephen.full-pick-text: The M1 MacBook Air is not for sale at the end of 2025
Stephen.notes: • Wal-Mart selling the M1 counted for it still being "on sale" moments before this, so one would assume they must stop selling it in 2025.

Stephen.text: Apple announces an updated Mac Pro
Stephen.full-pick-text: Apple announces an updated Mac Pro. The starting price remains at $6,999. The starting system on a chip is the Apple M3 Ultra chip with 32-core CPU, 80-core GPU, and 32-core Neural Engine. There is a build-to-order option that exceeds the unified memory available on the Mac Studio, which currently tops out at 512 GB.
Stephen.notes:
• "The starting price remains at $6,999."
  • "The starting system on a chip is the Apple M3 Ultra chip with 32-core CPU, 80-core GPU, and 32-core Neural Engine."
  • "There is a build-to-order option that exceeds the unified memory available on the Mac Studio, which currently tops out at 512 GB."
  • Like a previous pick, this pick was prophesied in a dream, and one detail of the dream (the size of the Mac Pro wheels) was already confirmed, so it's basically a lock.

Stephen.text: iPadOS gets updated window management tools
Stephen.full-pick-text: iPadOS gets updated window management tools

Stephen.text: The Google Gemini logo is shown on screen as part of a partnership announcement
Stephen.full-pick-text: The Google Gemini logo is shown on screen as part of a partnership announcement

Stephen.text: The new version of macOS drops support for some Intel Macs
Stephen.full-pick-text: The new version of macOS drops support for some Intel Macs

Myke.text: Apple introduces a new smart home product that features a screen...
Myke.full-pick-text: Apple introduces a new smart home product that features a screen. It will be in the HomePod line of products, it will feature eye/hand tracking as a way to control the interface without needing to touch the screen, and it will feature support for third party apps to run on the device.
Myke.notes:
• "It will be in the HomePod line of products."
  • "It will feature eye or hand tracking as a way to control the interface without needing to touch the screen."
  • "And it will feature support for third party apps to run on the device."
  • Apps may not necessarily come from a dedicated App Store, it may be more like CarPlay or some form of mirroring. Just widgets or Live Activities will not count, there has to be UI that you interact with.

Myke.text: Apple introduces its own LLM to power Siri
Myke.full-pick-text: Apple introduces its own LLM to power Siri
Myke.notes: • It does not have to ship in 2025, though.

Myke.text: Apple introduces the thinnest iPhone ever
Myke.full-pick-text: Apple introduces the thinnest iPhone ever

Myke.text: Mac Studio is updated with a new chip
Myke.full-pick-text: Mac Studio is updated with a new chip
Myke.notes: • The first ever bonus pick, thanks to a pick coming true after it was graded false. Before the hosts remembered that bonus picks were a thing now, this was a Flexie.

Myke.text: Apple has a new app for gamers
Myke.full-pick-text: Apple has a new app for gamers. It's called Apple Games. It creates new, specific developer terms for games. It features a partnership with Microsoft for Xbox Game Pass.
Myke.notes:
• "It's called Apple Games."
  • "It creates new, specific developer terms for games."
  • "It features a partnership with Microsoft for Xbox Game Pass."

Myke.text: New features are announced that are powered by Apple Intelligence
Myke.full-pick-text: New features are announced that are powered by Apple Intelligence

Myke.text: Significantly new OS design on at least one platform
Myke.full-pick-text: Significantly new OS design on at least one platform

Federico.text: A new "iPhone SE" is introduced with a new design
Federico.full-pick-text: A new "iPhone SE" is introduced with a new design
Federico.notes:
• Or something in its place, the name doesn't have to be "SE".
  • Ungraded, Stephen thinks this may be the first pick to come true in 2025.

Federico.text: A new AirTag is introduced with better tracking capabilities
Federico.full-pick-text: A new AirTag is introduced with better tracking capabilities

Federico.text: Apple announces a new standalone "Siri app" based on a new LLM that will...
Federico.full-pick-text: Apple announces a new standalone "Siri app" based on a new LLM that will be multilingual and support multiple languages at the same time, support multiple modalities – e.g. text input, voice input, and image attachments in the same conversation, and display content from third-party apps inline based on a new developer framework.
Federico.notes:
• "Be multilingual and support multiple languages at the same time."
  • "Support multiple modalities – e.g. text input, voice input, or image attachments in the same conversation."
  • "Display content from third-party apps inline based on a new developer framework."
  • If the overall pick about a "Siri app" is wrong, all the details will be counted as wrong as well. But that won't be a problem because Federico thinks that this approach is "so obvious".

Federico.text: Apple opens up AFM (Apple Foundation Model) to developers
Federico.full-pick-text: Apple opens up AFM (Apple Foundation Model) to developers. It's a 3B parameter version only that runs on device. It's designed in a way that only specific "endpoints" can be used with a native API, like summarization or writing or prioritizing content. Apple shows off examples of how they're using the same tech in its own system apps.
Federico.notes:
• "It's a 3B parameter version only that runs on device."
  • "It's designed in a way that only specific "endpoints" can be used with a native API, like summarization or writing or prioritizing content." (In other words, developers won't be able to prompt the API with arbitrary text, they only have access to particular tasks like summarization.)
  • "Apple shows off examples of how they're using the same tech in its own system apps."

Federico.text: Apple rebrands version numbers of its operating systems
Federico.full-pick-text: Apple rebrands version numbers of its operating systems

Federico.text: At least one visionOS app in compatibility mode becomes a native one
Federico.full-pick-text: At least one visionOS app in compatibility mode becomes a native one
